greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers n such that sigma(n)^n divides n^sigma(n).
comment: Numbers n such that A217872(n) divides A100879(n).
k-perfect numbers n (A007691) are terms iff k divides n.
maple: select(n->n &^ sigma(n) mod sigma(n)^n =0, [`$`(1..30000)]); # _Muniru A Asiru_, Mar 20 2018
program: (MAGMA) [n: n in[1..20000]  | n^SumOfDivisors(n) mod SumOfDivisors(n)^n eq 0]
(PARI) isok(n) = my(s = sigma(n)); Mod(n, s^n)^s == 0; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 23 2018
results.author: _Jaroslav Krizek_, Mar 20 2018
